Barack Obama and the former Bill Clinton didn't speak for nearly a month after the campaign ended. but they have made peace and the former Bill Clinton has offered to do whatever he can to help. there's nobody smarter in politics, Barack Obama said on cbs' "late show with David Letterman ," scheduled to air wednesday night. for the latest money news on mobile sms indian economy remains second fastest growing in the world mumbai: the indian economy continues to remain the second-fastest growing economy in the world, a top economist said on tuesday. india's economic fundamentals are quite robust and its economy remains the second-fastest growing one in the world, the prime minister's economic advisory council's chairman Suresh Tendulkar told reporters in mumbai. india was not experiencing a recession as other advanced economies and its economy would not be affected to the same extent as some other emerging

"investors were relieved by government moves to rescue the global financial system," said Kazuhiro Takahashi , general manager at daiwa securities smbc. since the opening, buying is spreading across the board. it was due to rallies in the u.s., european and asian markets yesterday. in new york, the dow Brent Jones industrial average gained more than 11%- its biggest one-day rally since 1933. investors were heartened by the u.s. government's move to inject capital into banks and get lending flowing
